bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, January 29, 1929

div1.p: Russell writes that he cannot locate the report she requested.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Laura Armistead Carter, January 29, 1929
div1.opener:
Book
Bib - Russell
SELSKAR M. GUNN, VICE PRESIDENT
IN EUROPE
ROGER S. GREENE, VICE PRESIDENT
IN FAR EAST
----
ASSOCIATE DIRECTORS
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
WILBUR A. LAWYER, M.D.
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES
GEORGE E. VINCENT
PRESIDENT
NORMA B. THOMPSON, SECRETARY
L. G. MYERS, TREASURER
GEORGE J. BEAL, COMPTROLLER
----
TRUSTEES DIVISIONAL COMMITTEE
THE PRESIDENT
SIMON FLEXNER
VERNON KELLOGG
WILLIAM ALLEN WHITE
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH DIVISION
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D., DIRECTOR
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “ROCKFOUND”
January 29, 1929
My dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
In your letter to me of December 5, 1928, you
refer to the Third Investigators' Report on the Non-Malarial
Fevers in West Africa. Mr. Van Wesep has already written
you informing you that this is unobtainable, even from the
English publishers. I wonder if the reference is of suf-
ficient importance for us to pursue the matter further, and,
if so, how far. We could endeavor through the second-hand
dealers of the world to find a copy, or if this is not success-
ful we could perhaps secure a photostat from the official copy
at the Colonial Office in London. Bacot's article to which
you refer is abstracted in the Tropical Diseases Bulletin,
Volume 8, 1916, page 410. The abstract is rather full. I
wonder if that would not serve your purpose. If it will not
we will look further. Bacot's part of the report is 191 pages long.
A photostat would cost us something like 30¢ a page so I am
not ordering it at the present time.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell Miss Laura A. Carter
The Westmoreland
2122 California Street NW
Washington, D.C.
FFR:R:DH
Copy to Dr. Frost
